official_title: To provide law enforcement authority for the federal protective service, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Federal Protective Service Act of 1989 - Amends Federal law to require the Administrator of the General Services Administration to maintain a uniformed force of law enforcement officers, known as the Federal Protective Service, to perform police functions with respect to public buildings and other property which the Administrator has a legal duty to protect and to perform other law enforcement functions assigned pursuant to law. Amends the Federal criminal code to grant such officers the authority to: (1) carry a firearm; (2) execute an order, warrant, subpoena, or other process issued under the authority of the United States for arrest, search and seizure, or production of evidence; and (3) make arrests without a warrant under certain circumstances. Includes members of the Federal Protective Service under the law providing for the protection of certain U.S. officers and employees.

titles.title: To provide law enforcement authority for the federal protective service, and for other purposes.
